programme.title: The Perfect Storm

The resulting battle with three merging weather fronts, an unheralded natural disaster, is gruelling and tragic. Based on the true-life bestselling novel by Sebastian Junger.

The story follows him from 9/11, through his tour of duty in Afghanistan, which scarred him forever, and into his early days in the Financial Intelligence Unit of the modern CIA where he becomes an analyst, under the guardianship of his handler, Harper. When Ryan believes he's uncovered a Russian plot to collapse the United States economy, he goes from being an analyst to becoming a spy and must fight to save his own life and those of countless others, while also trying to protect the thing that's more important to him than anything, his relationship with his fiancee Cathy.

programme.title: Drillbit Taylor
programme.desc: Owen Wilson stars in this riotous comedy from the producers of 'The 40-Year-Old Virgin' and the writers of 'Superbad'. When three young students, Ryan (Troy Gentile), Wade (Nate Hartley) and Emmit (David Dorfman) attend their first day at high school they come across school bully, Filkins (Alex Frost) who channels Hannibal Lecter. Coming up with the idea of getting some protection from this maniac, they place an ad in 'Soldier of Fortune' magazine looking for a bodyguard. Enter Drillbit Taylor (Wilson), not the best but definitely the cheapest of the mercenaries, hit men and bodyguards who respond. Drillbit is steely, dangerous and skilled in covert black-ops and exotic martial arts; he's also a complete fraud. Taylor enrols them in physical and mental training, steeling them, and possibly himself, for the ultimate clash against the forces of evil.

programme.title: Horrible Bosses 2

Soon, though, a slick investor pulls the rug out from under them. Outplayed and desperate, and with no legal recourse, the three would-be entrepreneurs hatch a misguided plan to kidnap the investor's adult son and ransom him to regain control of their company.
